Media.MediaTitle: Childhood Extracranial Germ Cell Tumor - Frazier Table

ImageData.LabelName: Table 4. Predicted Fraction of Pediatric Germ Cell Tumors Cured by Site, Age, and Stage Using Parameter Estimates from Cure Model
Patients age < 11 years with stage II to III testicular tumors
Patients age < 11 years with stage II to III ovarian tumors
Patients age < 11 years with stage IV testicular tumors
Patients age ≥ 11 years with stage II to III testicular tumors
Patients age < 11 years with stage IV ovarian tumors
Patients age < 11 years with stage II to III extragonadal tumors
Patients age ≥ 11 years with stage II to III ovarian tumors
Patients age ≥ 11 years with stage IV testicular tumors
Patients age < 11 years with stage IV extragonadal tumors
Patients age ≥ 11 years with stage IV ovarian tumors
Patients age ≥ 11 years with stage II to III extragonadal tumors
Patients age ≥ 11 years with stage IV extragondal tumors
Abbreviations: EFS, event-free survival; IGCCC, International Germ Cell Consensus Classification; LTDF, long-term disease free.
*3-year EFS is used here because longest follow-up in this category was 3.5 years.

OriginalSource.Creator: Journal of Clinical Oncology
OriginalSource.SourcePublication: Frazier AL, Hale JP, Rodriguez-Galindo C, et al: Revised risk classification for pediatric extracranial germ cell tumors based on 25 years of clinical trial data from the United Kingdom and United States. Journal of Clinical Oncology, Volume 33 (Issue 2), Pages 195-201, Copyright 2015.
